Lobby for Election Day Registration on January 28.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The 2020 election will be a crucial moment for Massachusetts and our nation, and given the Trump administration's enthusiasm for voter suppression, it's more important than ever that people have access to the ballot.

On Tuesday, January 28, the ACLU invites you to lobby at the Massachusetts State House for Election Day Registration. This groundbreaking bill would allow people to register or update their registration on Election Day, eliminating arbitrary barriers to voting and giving voice to marginalized communities who continue to be systematically disenfranchised.

Election Day Registration Lobby Day

Join us at the Massachusetts state house as we lobby for our voting rights!

Tuesday, January 28, 9:30 a.m. – 12 p.m.
The Massachusetts State House
24 Beacon St.
Boston, MA 02133

RSVP TODAY


As a member of the Election Modernization Coalition, the ACLU of Massachusetts has long been a champion for voting rights in the Commonwealth. Together with our partners, we've succeeded in passing key reforms like automatic voter registration, which took effect this year.

Election Day Registration is the gold standard for voting rights – one that many states have adopted. Now is our chance to make it a reality in Massachusetts. We hope you'll join us on January 28.

ACLU of Massachusetts
